greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is number of partitions of n having k distinct parts (n>=1, k>=1).
comment: Row n has floor([sqrt(1+8n)-1]/2) terms (number of terms increases by one at each triangular number).
Row sums yield the partition numbers (A000041).
Row n has length A003056(n), hence the first element of column k is in row A000217(k). - _Omar E. Pol_, Jan 19 2014
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..500, flattened
Emmanuel Briand, On partitions with k corners not containing the staircase with one more corner, arXiv:2004.13180 [math.CO], 2020.
Sang June Lee, Jun Seok Oh, On zero-sum free sequences contained in random subsets of finite cyclic groups, arXiv:2003.02511 [math.CO], 2020.
formula: T(n,1) = A000005(n) (number of divisors of n).
Sum_{k>=0} k! * T(n,k) = A274174(n). - _Alois P. Heinz_, Jun 13 2016
T(n + A000217(k), k) = A000712(n), for 0 <= n <= k [Briand]. - _Álvar Ibeas_, Nov 04 2020
maple: g:=product(1+t*x^j/(1-x^j),j=1..30)-1: gser:=simplify(series(g,x=0,27)): for n from 1 to 23 do P[n]:=sort(coeff(gser,x^n)) od: for n from 1 to 23 do seq(coeff(P[n],t^j),j=1..floor(sqrt(1+8*n)/2-1/2)) od; # yields sequence in triangular form
b:= proc(n, i) option remember; local j; if n=0 then 1
elif i<1 then 0 else []; for j from 0 to n/i do zip((x, y)
mathematica: Table[Length /@ Split[Sort[Length /@ Union /@ IntegerPartitions@n]], {n, 22}] // Flatten (* _Robert Price_, Jun 13 2020 *)
xref: Cf. A060177 (reflected rows). - _Alois P. Heinz_, Jan 29 2014
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_, Feb 19 2006
